awd_titl_txt: Peach State LSAMP - Extending the STEM Pipeline in
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

inst.inst_name: University of Georgia Research Foundation Inc
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA RESEARCH FOUNDATION, INC.

por.por_cntn:
Peach State LSAMP funded by the National Science Foundation (NSF), implemented phase III of its programing from September 15, 2016 - August 31, 2022 with the mission to significantly increase the number of historically underrepresented students in the Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines who enroll in and complete baccalaureate degrees. The Peach State Alliance is comprised of a diverse mix of six public institutions with a history of established academic strengths and capabilities.

The participating institutions include the University of Georgia (UGA - lead institution), Fort Valley State University (FVSU - historically Black College or University (HBCU)), Georgia State University Perimeter College (GSU-PC ? two-year institution), Georgia Institute of Technology (GT - research institution), Kennesaw State University - Kennesaw Campus (KSU-K - research institution), Kennesaw State University - Marietta Campus (KSU-M - research institution), and Savannah State University (SSU - HBCU).

Peach State LSAMP leveraged the resources, partnerships, and commitments of each member institution to provide academic, social, and financial support for underrepresented minorities (URMs) pursuing STEM fields of study. Through their collaborative Peach State LSAMP efforts, they have significantly advanced their academic objectives and collectively achieved greater outcomes than would have been achieved through their individual efforts.

In order to fulfill the goals of the grant, the Peach State LSAMP offered the following activities and programs:

  • Incoming Freshman and Transfer Summer Bridge Programs
  • Peer Mentoring and Study Groups
  • LSAMP Drop-In Centers
  • Tutoring and Academic Support
  • Career and Academic Workshops
  • Student Stipends and Research Scholarships
  • Faculty Mentored Undergraduate Research
  • Summer Internship and Research Opportunities (externally funded)
  • Travel Awards for Local and National Conferences
  • Graduate School Preparation

The Peach State LSAMP program has funded 1739 students as general or research scholars. The Alliance has had 502 scholars to graduate and 181 graduates to self-report enrollment in graduate or professional school. One hundred and nineteen (119) Peach State LSAMP scholars transferred from two-year institutions. Other outcomes include 1,230 funded research opportunities (on-site, off-site, and international), 523 LSAMP workshops, 597 scholars have presented at conferences and 53 students were contributing authors for research publications during this grant funding.  See attached Peach State LSAMP Outcomes 2016-2022 image summarizing this information.

The Peach State LSAMP program has yielded successful outcomes exceeding both enrollment in STEM majors and STEM degree completion for URM students. Enrollment of URM students in STEM majors has increased 45% from the Baseline (2014) to 2021. Degree completion in STEM for URM students increased by 119% from the Baseline (2014) to 2021. See attached enrollment and BS degree images.

Prior to the COVID-19 Pandemic, there was a 67% increase the number of GSU-PC LSAMP students who transferred to a four-year college majoring in STEM disciplines; and a 46% increase in LSAMP students participating in faculty-mentored research. Additionally, in 2021, there was a 10% increase in LSAMP graduates self-reporting to be enrolled in graduate school. 

An original journal research paper entitled Georgia State University Perimeter College LSAMP Transfer Bridge Program: A Path Forward for Broadening Participation in STEM, for the project research study was published in Frontiers in STEM Education Journal in October 2021. Results from the research analyses indicated that Transfer Bridge participants were significantly more likely to enroll in a four-year STEM program, receive a STEM bachelor's degree, enroll in a post-baccalaureate STEM program, and receive a STEM post-baccalaureate degree than non-Transfer Bridge students. 

 

 


Last Modified: 12/20/2022
Modified by: Michelle Cook
